review: Years ago, I fell in love with the Tivo. For a long time, it was one of the central pieces of entertainment gear I needed wherever I was living. Over time, as content has moved off the physical space and into the online sphere, that need has moved to the Roku. I've used several of the bigger cousins to the 3500R and have had almost nothing to complain about. The biggest selling point for me with the Roku is that it allows you to tailor it to what you want, and offers as much in the way of entertainment as any box 5 or 6 times it's size. Between Netflix and Amazon Prime for streaming off the net to the Plex app for my home media server, this thing does it all. I picked up the Roku Stick to use in an area with tight spacing. The performance has been close to on par with the bigger models, although I've run into a few random bugs that made a reboot necessary. It's also a bit slower than the boxes, but with the small size this is to be expected. Overall, it's still a great Roku product and still outclasses bigger and more expensive entertainment solutions.
